New Records: The Dodgers posted the largest shutout win in franchise postseason history.
Key Match Events: Mookie Betts homered for the second straight night
Shohei Ohtani hit an RBI single
Will Smith and Gavin Lux each hit a two-run homer
Evan Phillips retired Jurickson Profar, Manny Machado and Jackson Merrill on five pitches in the sixth
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers manager Dave Roberts emphasized the importance of efficiency in the strike zone for the bullpen game
Post-Match Reflections: Dodgers manager Dave Roberts expressed pride in the team's resilience and response to adversity
Mookie Betts said he's just focused on doing his part for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Padres won 10-2 at Dodger Stadium in Game 2 on Sunday night, when tempers flared on the field and in the stands
The winner will have home-field advantage in the National League Championship Series against the New York Mets
